IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY IS A NATIONAL CHARITY. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH DONORS AND VOLUNTEERS OUR MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF ALL THOSE AFFECTED BY CANCER THROUGH WORLD-CLASS RESEARCH TRANSFORMATIVE ADVOCACY AND COMPASSIONATE SUPPORT.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY IS A NATIONAL CANCER CHARITY. IN TRUSTED PARTNERSHIP WITH DONORS AND VOLUNTEERS OUR MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF ALL THOSE AFFECTED BY CANCER THROUGH WORLD-CLASS RESEARCH TRANSFORMATIVE ADVOCACY AND COMPASSIONATE SUPPORT.
IRS990.Desc: RESEARCH: RESEARCH FUNDING AND COSTS OF SUPPORTING RESEARCH PROGRAMS. RESEARCH FUNDING PROJECTS PERSONNEL AND RESEARCH CENTRES FOCUSES ON THE ADVANCEMENT OF KNOWLEDGE IN CANCER RISK REDUCTION AND PREVENTION SCREENING DIAGNOSIS TREATMENT CURE SUPPORTIVE CARE SURVIVORSHIP AND END-OF-LIFE CARE THROUGH BASIC-BIOMEDICAL TRANSLATIONAL CLINICAL BEHAVIOURAL AND POPULATION-BASED RESEARCH. SUPPORTING RESEARCH PROGRAMS INCLUDE ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE PEER-REVIEW PROCESS PROGRAM ADMINISTRATION RESEARCH FORUMS ADVISORY COMMITTEES AND LINKAGE WITH RESEARCHERS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: PROGRAMS: CONSIST OF HEALTH PROMOTION FOR CANADIANS TOBACCO CESSATION HEALTHY EATING PHYSICAL ACTIVITY REDUCED EXPOSURE TO CARCINOGENS SCREENING AND OF SUPPORT TO CANCER PATIENTS AND CAREGIVERS DURING AND BEYOND THE CANCER JOURNEY. THIS INCLUDES INFORMATION EMOTIONAL AND PRACTICAL SUPPORT PROGRAMS ARE DELIVERED IN THE COMMUNITY BY TELEPHONE IN PRINT OR THROUGH THE INTERNET WEBSITE AND SOCIAL MEDIA. EXAMPLES OF PROGRAMS ARE COMMUNITY OUTREACH WORKPLACE WELLNESS SMOKING CESSATION INFORMATION AND SUPPORT SERVICES LODGES TRANSPORTATION FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE WIGS PROSTHESIS AND RELATED ACTIVITIES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: ADVOCACY: ACTIVITIES RELATED TO INFLUENCING POLICY MAKERS TO IMPLEMENT PUBLIC POLICIES AND PROGRAMS THAT ENABLE THE ADOPTION OF HEALTHY BEHAVIOURS REDUCTION OF OCCUPATIONAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CARCINOGENS ACCESS TO ORGANIZED CANCER SCREENING PROGRAMS AND QUALITY CANCER CARE FROM DIAGNOSIS TO PALLIATIVE CARE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR CANCER PATIENTS AND CAREGIVERS AND INVESTMENT IN CANCER RESEARCH ACTIVITIES. THIS WORK INCLUDES DEVELOPING POSITIONS RAISING PUBLIC AWARENESS MOBILIZING COMMUNITIES BUILDING COALITIONS AND LOBBYING.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: EVP MISSION INFORMATION AND SUPPORT SERVICE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: | PartandLinenumber:,Explanation:| Part2SectionBLine1b,MOST OF THE SOCIETY'S ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED BY ITS OWN STAFF AND THE EXPENDITURES REPORTED IN SCHEDULE C PART II-B IN LARGE PART REPRESENT THE COSTS OF STAFF TIME. ALL OF THE SOCIETY'S ADVOCACY ACTIVITIES ARE CONDUCTED IN CANADA.| Part2SectionBLine1g,THE SOCIETY ENGAGES IN VARIOUS ADVOCACY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO INFLUENCING CANADIAN POLICY MAKERS TO IMPLEMENT PUBLIC POLICIES AND PROGRAMS THAT ENABLE THE ADOPTION OF HEALTHY BEHAVIOURS REDUCTION OF OCCUPATIONAL AND ENVIRONMENTAL CARCINOGENS ACCESS TO ORGANIZED CANCER SCREENING PROGRAMS AND QUALITY CANCER CARE FROM DIAGNOSIS TO PALLIATIVE CARE FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR CANCER PATIENTS AND CAREGIVERS INVESTMENT IN CANCER RESEARCH AND OTHER CANCER CONTROL INITIATIVES.| Part2SectionBLine1i,ACTIVITIES INCLUDE DEVELOPING POSITIONS RAISING PUBLIC AWARENESS MOBILIZING COMMUNITIES BUILDING COALITIONS AND LOBBYING.|

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DEFINED BENEFIT LIABILITY FOR POST-RETIREMENT BENEFITS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Part V Line 4 : ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE RESTRICTED ACCORDING TO DONOR WISHES AND MAY ONLY BE USED TO SUPPORT SPECIFIC CHARITABLE PROGRAMS FOR THE MOST PART THE SOCIETY KEEPS THE ENDOWMENTS PRINCIPAL INTACT AND UTILIZES THE REVENUE EARNED THEREFROM TO FUND CHARITABLE PROGRAMS.
Part XI Line 2d : DIRECT LOTTERY EXPENSES OF $5,786,235 ARE NETTED AGAINST THE GROSS INCOME FROM LOTTERIES AND EXCLUDED FROM EXPENSES.
Part XII Line 2d : DIRECT LOTTERY EXPENSES OF $5,786,235 ARE NETTED AGAINST THE GROSS INCOME FROM LOTTERIES AND EXCLUDED FROM EXPENSES.

THE SOCIETY OFFERS A NUMBER OF GRANT PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT RESEARCH HEALTHCARE AND SCIENCE. FOR MORE INFORMATION - PLEASE SEE OUR WEBSITE AT: HTTP: WWW.CANCER.CA EN RESEARCH GRANTS-AND-AWARDS CURRENT-FUNDING-OPPORTUNITIES THE SOCIETY ASSEMBLES MULTIDISCIPLINARY PEER REVIEW COMMITTEES TO REVIEW THE GRANT APPLICATIONS. PEER REVIEW COMMITTEES WILL CONSIST OF SCIENTIFIC EXPERTS WITH BROAD EXPERTISE ALONG WITH COMMUNITY REPRESENTATIVES TO PROVIDE PATIENT SURVIVOR CAREGIVER PERSPECTIVES. ALTHOUGH THE SOCIETY PROVIDES GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS WHO HAVE BEEN APPROVED THROUGH THE GRANTING PROCESS ALL PAYMENTS ARE ISSUED TO THE ORGANIZATION SPONSORING THE INDIVIDUAL'S RESEARCH. FOR 990 REPORTING PURPOSES SINCE WE PAY THE ORGANIZATION AND NOT THE INDIVIDUAL DIRECTLY WE HAVE LISTED ALL GRANTS UNDER THE ORGANIZATION NOT THE INDIVIDUAL. THE SOCIETY REQUIRES ALL GRANTEES TO SUBMIT ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS ABOUT THE STATUS OF THEIR RESEARCH.

RltdOrgOfficerTrstKeyEmplGrp.TitleTxt: EVP MISSION INFORMATION AND SUPPORT SERVICE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CCS SELLS THE DONATED SECURITIES. DONATED ARTS ARE SOLD AT THE EVENT BY THE EVENT ORGANIZER. LIFE INSURANCE POLICIES ARE PROCESSED BY THE INSURANCE COMPANIES.

CANADIAN CANCER SOCIETY MEMBERSHIP IS COMPRISED OF 25 MEMBERS DRAWN FROM: 1. THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS 2. MEMBERS OF THE NATIONAL COUNCIL WHO ARE THE PROVINCIAL BOARD CHAIRS BUT WHO ARE NOT DIRECTORS; AND 3. ONE OTHER MEMBERS ON NATIONAL COUNCIL CHOSEN BY PROVINCIAL BOARDS WHEN ITS PROVINCIAL BOARD CHAIR OR PRESIDENT IS A DIRECTOR.

THE MEMBERS OF THE CORPORATION ELECT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE SOCIETY'S BYLAWS AUTHORIZE THE MEMBERS TO REMOVE FROM OFFICE ANY DIRECTORS AT ANY TIME WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE BY ORDINARY RESOLUTION. MEMBERS MAY ELECT A REPLACEMENTS FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE DIRECTORS' TERM. THE BOARD MAY REMOVE ANY DIRECTORS FOR CAUSE ON MOTION OF ANY TWO DIRECTORS AT ANY BOARD MEETING. THE BOARD MAY VOTE TO REPLACE REMOVED DIRECTORS BY ORDINARY RESOLUTION OR PROPOSE AN ELECTION AT MEMBERS' MEETING CALLED FOR THAT PURPOSE. REPLACEMENT DIRECTORS WILL HOLD OFFICE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE TERM OF OFFICE OF THE DIRECTORS REMOVED.
THE SOCIETY'S BYLAWS RESERVE CERTAIN POWERS TO THE MEMBERS INCLUDING THE POWER TO AMEND THE SOCIETY'S BYLAWS AND APPOINT AN EXTERNAL AUDITOR TO AUDIT THE SOCIETY'S FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
REVIEW CONDUCTED BY EVP FINANCE & OPERATIONS.
REVIEW CONDUCTED BY EVP FINANCE & OPERATIONS.

THE SOCIETY HAS A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY IN PLACE TO ENSURE THAT OFFICERS DIRECTORS AND KEY-EMPLOYEES OBSERVE BEST BUSINESS PRACTICES AND ACT IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE SOCIETY RATHER THAN TO ADVANCE THEIR OWN PERSONAL END. THE SOCIETY WILL CONDUCT ITS BUSINESS IN SUCH A MANNER THAT THE PERSONAL INTERESTS OF EMPLOYEES DO NOT INTERFERE WITH GOOD JUDGEMENT OR DECISION-MAKING. EMPLOYEES SHALL NOT KNOWINGLY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF OR BENEFIT FROM INFORMATION THAT IS OBTAINED IN THE COURSE OF THEIR OFFICIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES; SHALL AVOID SITUATIONS IN WHICH THEIR PERSONAL INTEREST CONFLICT OR MAY CONFLICT WITH THEIR DUTIES TO THE SOCIETY; AND SHALL DISCLOSE ANY CONFLICT OF INTEREST. IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS IDENTIFIED THE SOCIETY WILL TAKE THE NECESSARY PRECAUTIONARY MEASURES TO ENSURE THAT THE BEST INTERESTS OF THE ORGANIZATION ARE SAFEGUARDED.

THE SOCIETY TAKES ITS RESPONSIBILITY IN DETERMINING THE COMPENSATION FOR BOTH ITS CEO AND OTHER OFFICER CLASS VERY SERIOUSLY. THE SOCIETY UNDERTAKES A THOROUGH AND DETAILED PROCESS TO ENSURE THAT THE COMPENSATION IT PAYS IS COMMENSURATE WITH OTHER INSTITUTIONS IN ITS PEER CLASS. THE SOCIETY PERIODICALLY COMMISIONS A COMPENSATION STUDY FROM AN INDEPENDENT THIRD PARTY TO DETERMINE THE CEO'S COMPENSATION. THIS STUDY IS USED AS THE FOUNDATION FOR DETERMINING THE CEO COMPENSATION. THE BOARD DELIBERATES ON THE APPROPRIATE COMPENSATION AND ITS DECISION IS DOCUMENTED IN THE COMMITTEE MINUTES. THE COMPENSATION PROCEDURE FOR THE REMAINDER OF THE OFFICER CLASS FOLLOWS A SIMILAR PROCESS WITH THE CEO UTILIZING EXTERNALLY PREPARED COMPENSATION SURVEY AND OTHER MARKET DATA TO ARRIVE AT FAIR COMPENSATION BENCHMARKS FOR NEWLY RECRUITED OFFICER LEVEL STAFF.

THE SOCIETY MAKES ITS FROM 990 AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC BY RETAINING A COPY AT ITS PLACE OF BUSINESS. THE FORM 990 IS LIKEWISE PUBLISHED ON THE INTERNET AT WWW.GUIDESTAR.ORG. THE SOCIETY'S FINANCIAL STATEMTNES ARE POSTED ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE; GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY ARE NOT ORDINARILY MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PLUBLIC BUT IF REQUESTED WILL BE PROVIDED AT MANAGEMENT'S DISCRETION.

| Explanation:| SCHEDULE G PART I LINE 2a THE SOCIETY DOES NOT ENGAGE IN ANY FORMAL FUNDRAISING IN THE UNITED STATES AND DOES NOT PAY PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISERS TO SOLICIT CONTRIBUTIONS FROM UNITED STATES RESIDENTS. THE SOCIETY DOES ENGAGE PROFESSIONAL FUNDRAISERS IN CANADA; HOWEVER THE INFORMATION NECESSARY TO COMPLETE SCHEDULE G PART I IS UNAVAILABLE AT THIS TIME. THIS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
